DataElement.preferredName: Prior Immunotherapy And/Or Monoclonal Antibody Therapy Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to the prior administration of immunotherapy, including monoclonal antibody therapy as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Immunotherapy And/Or Monoclonal Antibody Therapy Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Therapy designed to induce changes in a patient's immune status in order to treat disease._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._The use of monoclonal antibodies in the treatment of any disease or disorder._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:(IM-yoo-no-THER-a-pee) Treatment to stimulate or restore the ability of the immune system to fight infections and other diseases. Also used to lessen side effects that may be caused by some cancer treatments.

Concepts.definition: Therapy designed to induce changes in a patient's immune status in order to treat disease.

Property.preferredName: And/Or Monoclonal Antibody Therapy Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:The use of monoclonal antibodies in the treatment of any disease or disorder.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The use of monoclonal antibodies in the treatment of any disease or disorder.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received immunoth
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received immunotherapy (including monoclonal antibodies) within 4 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving immunotherapy or immunosuppressive drugs (e.g. chemotherapy or systemic corticosteroids) at the time of enrollment except as noted in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy with nivolumab or other agents targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 3 weeks or 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter, must have elapsed since any prior vaccine or monoclonal antibody therapy prior to leukapheresis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 3 weeks elapsed since prior therapy that included a monoclonal antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients undergoing leukapheresis: Prior to leukapheresis have at least 3 weeks or 5 half-lives, whichever is short, elapsed since any prior vaccine or monoclonal antibody therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received immunotherapy within 21 days of Cycle 1 Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received previous vaccine therapy or anti-GD2 mAb therapy?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.2 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002682. ak
